image.altText: Mark Rutte and Donald Trump in conversation while seated in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The US agrees to provide Ukraine with a new tranche of desperately needed weapons, with NATO footing the bill, as Donald Trump threatens Russia with economic punishment "if we don't have a deal in 50 days".

title.children: US and NATO strike deal to arm Ukraine as Trump gives Putin a deadline

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Xi Jinping composite

props.synopsis: The high-profile meeting will likely see Australia's prime minister raise several contentious issues, while also celebrating economic ties.

title.children: Albanese's two meetings with Xi 'a clear sign of goodwill' to China's elites

image.altText: housing minister Clare O'Neil speaking at press conference with Prime Minister anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Labor has been given several policy options to expand on its housing agenda after Jim Chalmers acknowledged yesterday its signature target was not on track.

title.children: Support payment for renters on Treasury's housing options list

image.altText: Illustration of a smashed piggy bank leaking coins, with a hammer in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Welfare for the wealthy. The battle over superannuation reform.

title.children: Who’s a dole bludger now? Why our wealthy are fighting to retain a super rort

image.altText: A brain on a tray in a lab.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists find the first evidence of an unusual pattern of brain scarring only seen in people repeatedly exposed to blast waves.

title.children: Navy SEALS and ADF soldiers suffering the same horrific brain injuries

image.altText: Man with dark hair and a beard sits at a table and looks at his ipad.

props.synopsis: Jarod Graham says he is owed nearly $10,000 in unpaid superannuation from his former boss. He's not the only one.

title.children: A third of young workers are exploited, with many never receiving entitlements

image.altText: A man holds his hand up in celebration of a wicket.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc takes five wickets, including the 400th of his Test career, in a remarkable spell of pink ball bowling as the West Indies spiral in pursuit of 204 to win the third Test in Jamaica. Follow live.

title.children: Mitchell Starc takes fastest five wicket haul in Test history to spark chaos on day three

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Josh Hazlewood is in on the act! West Indies are 6-11
MITCHELL STARC HAS FIVE WICKETS IN 15 BALLS!

image.altText: A close up of a mother holding her son who has his arms wrapped around her.

props.synopsis: A survey of nearly 400 women around Australia found a delay in diagnosing birth injuries is leading to more severe mental health issues.

title.children: A delay in diagnosing childbirth injuries is affecting women's mental health, survey finds

image.altText: A woman surrounded by other pro-independence demonstrators holds up a Kanak flag behind her back.

props.synopsis: Observers say regardless of the enthusiasm of French President Emmanuel Macron, the deal faces a long and uncertain path before it can take effect. So, how did it get to this point, and what needs to happen for it to take effect?

title.children: Macron calls New Caledonia deal 'a bet on trust' but to some, it’s 'betrayal'

image.altText: Carolina Wilga smiles at the camera in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Carolina Wilga is recovering in a Perth hospital after being exposed to 11 nights of freezing temperatures alone in WA's outback.

title.children: German backpacker issues first public comments since 11-night ordeal

image.altText: Joshua Brown in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: Helen says alleged child sex offender Joshua Dale Brown should have been removed from the sector two years ago after he was investigated for "dropping" her one-year-old baby at Creative Garden Early Learning Centre Point Cook.

title.children: 'Constant excuses': Mum of child dropped by alleged sex offender details investigation

image.altText: Tony Burke wearing a dark blazer and blue tie, emotionless while standing and wearing dark-framed glasses

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes Australia's antisemitic envoy when she says she had no knowledge of donations made by a trust linked to her husband to right wing lobby group Advance.

title.children: 'Believe her': Burke backs Segal's denial of knowledge about Advance donation

image.altText: a couple sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Some in the industry say the case highlights the need for more to be done to stop unlicensed contractors promising to complete small jobs.

title.children: Couple loses thousands to unlicensed builder who is now in jail

image.altText: a long stretch of blue hallway in a sterile, brightly lit warehouse

props.synopsis: Documents show Greater Western Water is assessing 19 data centre applications requesting to use a total of 20 gigalitres of water annually — the same amount 330,000 Melburnians used in the last financial year.

title.children: Data centres in Melbourne's west could threaten water supply, experts say

image.altText: Man donates plasma

props.synopsis: Thousands of members of the LGBTQI+ and sex worker communities can now donate plasma in Australia without having to wait three months from the last time they had sex.

title.children: More Australians can now donate plasma. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A large sandstone block sits on red carpet with two iron rings imbedded in it

props.synopsis: Arnaud Harixcalde Logan appeared in a Scottish court charged with "malicious mischief" after allegedly damaging the glass case which held the stone.

title.children: Kilt-clad Sydney man charged after allegedly smashing Stone of Scone case

image.altText: A court room with lawyers and judges in black gowns standing around a semi-circle shaped table arrangement and bench

props.synopsis: A German doctor, identified only as Johannes M, is facing trial in Berlin accused of murdering patients by administering an anaesthetic and muscle relaxer without their knowledge or consent.

title.children: German doctor accused of murdering his patients stands trial

image.altText: A fire official in hi-vis looks at a building

props.synopsis: Firefighters were met with heavy smoke and flames at the front of the building, with occupants trapped inside, officials said.

title.children: At least nine dead after fire at Massachusetts assisted living facility

image.altText: Wind turbines black and white.

props.synopsis: International energy companies are reconsidering their investments in Australian offshore wind projects as the Trump administration's disruption of the industry causes global uncertainty.

title.children: Australian offshore wind projects buffeted by global 'headwinds'

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: A magistrate sentences a father of four for sending an "abhorrent" email to South Australia's police commissioner just hours after his son's death.

title.children: Magistrate lashes cruel email mocking police chief's grief

image.altText: Sheep in an open paddock

props.synopsis: The English Leicester makes no sense or cents on the farm's profit and loss sheet, but some farmers are passionate about the breed and its long, lustrous fleece.

title.children: Heritage sheep breed from industrial revolution kept alive in rural Tasmania

image.altText: a composite image of bradfield candidates Liberal Gisele Kapterian and independent Nicolette Boele

props.synopsis: There were just 26 votes between independent teal Nicolette Boele and Liberal Gisele Kapterian when the result was finally called more than a month after the federal election.

title.children: Liberals to launch legal action over election result in Sydney seat of Bradfield

image.altText: A cartoon of a man in a green T shirt with black reading glasses

props.synopsis: Police discovered a loaded, unregistered gun on Mohammad Noori following a run in with MCG security.

title.children: Man sentenced to 21 months in prison following MCG security breach

image.altText: Gregg Wallace photographed close up smiling while wearing black-rimmed glasses, a black jacket and blue shirt

props.synopsis: A report has found 45 of 83 misconduct allegations made against former MasterChef UK host Gregg Wallace were substantiated, with the BBC saying his return to the show is now "untenable".

title.children: BBC cuts ties with former MasterChef UK host amid misconduct allegations

image.altText: Two men hugging, old photo.

props.synopsis: An Illawarra man fatally struck his father over the head, leaving him for dead in the family backyard for up to two days, a Supreme Court trial has heard.

title.children: Son on trial for allegedly murdering father in Wollongong backyard

image.altText: A photo of wave-shaped clouds over the Australia outback

props.synopsis: Westerly winds over Main Range caused an oscillating "mountain wave" effect which lasted a few hours on Monday.

title.children: Queensland gets a look at spectacular cloud formations

image.altText: A group of people leave a courthouse. A man and a woman holding hands are at the front of the group.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is suing the government for malicious prosecution after it took a Supreme Court jury less than an hour to acquit him of two counts of rape.

title.children: Police officer sues after being acquitted of rape by a jury in less than an hour

image.altText: A woman with short, dark, curly hair wipes away a tear as she stands outside a court building and faces the media.

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg successfully fought for her freedom after being convicted of killing her four children. Now she is locked in what her lawyer says is a "really, really disheartening" battle for compensation.

title.children: Kathleen Folbigg locked in 'disheartening' battle for compensation

image.altText: A mother koala with a baby koala on her back, clinging to a tree.

props.synopsis: A "disastrous" state government-led translocation project to repopulate an area of national park results in seven koala deaths.

title.children: Seven koalas die during NSW national park translocation project

image.altText: Red brick building with a sign reading court house.

props.synopsis: Carpenter Terry Dunn suffered life-changing injuries, including a fractured skull, six broken ribs and a punctured lung when he fell through a doorway and into the pool at a work site in 2021.

title.children: Collapsed Perth builder fined $750k for worker's fall into empty pool

image.altText: Puppies rescued by RSPCA

props.synopsis: The RSPCA says inspectors found sticky residue on each of the dogs' paws, which they say suggests their legs had also been bound.

title.children: RSPCA investigating after puppies found with mouths taped shut

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: A man has died after an ambulance took 17 minutes to arrive at a priority one case at Sellicks Hill, south of Adelaide, with the ambulance employees union raising concerns about ramping and resourcing.

title.children: Ambulance union raises response time concerns after SA man's death

image.altText: Rosie O'Donnel smiles and waves at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: The actor, talk show host and comedian has publicly criticised US president on social media in the past week, but it's not the first time she's been vocal against him.

title.children: Why has Trump threatened to revoke US-born Rosie O'Donnell's citizenship?
